required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Switch to Doravirine/Islatravir (DOR/ISL) in Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 (HIV-1) Participants Treated With Bictegravir/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Alafenamide (BIC/FTC/TAF) (MK-8591A-018)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Double-Blind Clinical Study to Evaluate a Switch to Doravirine/Islatravir (DOR/ISL) Once-Daily in Participants With HIV- 1 Virologically Suppressed on Bictegravir/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Alafenamide (BIC/FTC/TAF)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of a switch to MK-8591A (a fixed dose combination of doravirine and islatravir) in human immunodeficiency virus -1 (HIV-1)-infected participants virologically suppressed on a regimen of bictegravir/emtricitabine/tenofovir alafenamide (BIC/FTC/TAF). The primary hypothesis is that a switch to MK-8591A will be non-inferior to continued treatment with BIC/FTC/TAF as assessed by the proportion of participants with HIV-1 ribonucleic acid (RNA) ≥50 copies/mL at Week 48.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with (Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 ribonucleic acid ) HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with (Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 ribonucleic acid) HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL at Week 48

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with one or more adverse events (AEs) up to Week 48
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with one or more adverse events (AEs) up to Week 48

primary_outcome.measure: Participants who discontinued study intervention due to an AE up to Week 48
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who discontinued study intervention due to an AE up to Week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL at Week 96

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with HIV-1 RNA <40 or <50 copies/mL at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA <40 or <50 copies/mL at Week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with HIV-1 RNA <40 or <50 copies/mL at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA <40 or <50 copies/mL at Week 96
Change from baseline in CD4+ T-cell count at Week 48
Change from baseline in CD4+ T-cell count at Week 96

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with evidence of viral drug resistance-associated substitutions at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage participants with evidence of viral drug resistance-associated substitutions at Week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with evidence of viral drug resistance-associated substitutions at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage participants with evidence of viral drug resistance-associated substitutions at Week 96

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in body weight at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in body weight at Week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in body weight at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in body weight at Week 96

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with one or more AEs up to Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with one or more AEs up to Week 96

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants who discontinued study intervention due to an AE up to Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who discontinued study intervention due to an AE up to Week 96

arm_group.description: A fixed dose combination (FDC) of 100 mg doravirine (DOR)/0.75 mg islatravir (ISL) for 96 weeks; and placebo to Bictegravir/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Alafenamide (BIC/FTC/TAF) for 96 weeks
50 mg bictegravir (BIC), 200 mg emtricitabine (FTC), 25 mg tenofovir alafenamide (TAF) for 96 weeks, and placebo to FDC DOR/ISL for 96 weeks

intervention.description: 100 mg DOR/ 0.75 ISL FDC tablet taken orally once daily
50 mg BIC, 200 mg FTC, and 25 mg TAF combined in a single tablet, taken orally once daily
Placebo to BIC/FTC/TAF in a single tablet taken orally, once daily
Placebo to FDC DOR/ISL in a tablet taken orally, once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Is HIV-1 positive with plasma (Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1) HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at screening.
- Has been receiving BIC/FTC/TAF therapy with documented viral suppression (HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL) for ≥3 months prior to signing informed consent and has no history of prior virologic treatment failure on any past or current regimen.
- Female is eligible to participate if she is not pregnant or breastfeeding, and at least one of the following conditions applies: Is not a woman of childbearing potential (WOCBP); is a WOCBP and using an acceptable contraceptive method, or be abstinent from heterosexual intercourse as their preferred and usual lifestyle; a WOCBP must have a negative highly sensitive pregnancy test ([urine or serum] as required by local regulations) within 24 hours before the first dose of study intervention; if a urine test cannot be confirmed as negative (e.g. an ambiguous result), a serum pregnancy test is required. In such cases, the participant must be excluded from participation if the serum pregnancy result is positive;
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has HIV-2 infection
- Has an active diagnosis of hepatitis due to any cause, including active Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) co-infection
- Has a history of malignancy ≤5 years prior to signing informed consent except for adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer, in situ cervical cancer, or cutaneous Kaposi's sarcoma
- Is taking or is anticipated to require systemic immunosuppressive therapy, immune modulators, or any prohibited therapies
- Is currently participating in or has participated in a clinical study with an investigational compound or device from 45 days prior to Day 1 through the study treatment period.
- Has a documented or known virologic resistance to DOR,
- Female expects to conceive or donate eggs at any time during the study
